sen.j: 淀藩（よどはん）は、山城国（現在の京都府京都市伏見区淀本町）に存在した藩。
sen.e: The Yodo Domain was located in the Province of Yamashiro (present-day Yodohon Town, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture).
The Yodo Domain was located in the Province of Yamashiro (present-day Yodohon Town, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture).
The Yodo Domain was located in the Yamashiro Province (present-day Yodohon cho, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture).

sen.j: 元和 (日本)9年（1623年）、松平定綱が遠州掛川藩より3万5000石で入ったことにより、淀藩が立藩した。
sen.e: In 1623, the Yodo Domain was established when Sadatsuna MATSUDAIRA entered the domain from the Kakegawa Domain in Enshu with 35,000 koku.
In 1623, the Yodo Domain was established when Sadatsuna MATSUDAIRA from the Kakegawa Domain in Enshu Province took over the domain with assigned revenues of 35,000 koku.
sen.cmt: Clarified what is meant by "with 30,000 koku."
sen.e: In 1623, the Yodo Domain was established when Sadatsuna MATSUDAIRA from the Kakegawa Domain in Enshu Province took over the domain with assigned revenues of 35,000 koku.

sen.j: これは、先年に廃藩となった伏見藩に代わって、新たに京都を防備するために立藩されたのである。
sen.e: The Yodo Domain was established to protect Kyoto as a replacement of the Fushimi Domain, which was abolished the year before.
The Yodo Domain was established to protect Kyoto as a replacement for the Fushimi Domain, which had been abolished the year before.
The Yodo Domain was established to protect Kyoto as a replacement for the Fushimi Domain, which had been abolished the year before.

sen.j: 定綱は淀城の築城に尽力した。
sen.e: Sadatsuna worked for the construction of the Yodo Castle.
Sadatsuna worked on the construction of Yodo Castle.
Sadatsuna worked on the construction of Yodo Castle.

sen.j: ちなみにこの淀城は、かつて豊臣秀頼の生母であった淀殿の居城で知られる淀城とは場所が異なると言われている。
sen.e: In fact, this castle was in a different place where the Yodo Castle known as the residence of Lady Yodo (Hideyori TOYOTOMI's real mother) was located.
This castle was, it is to be noted, in a different place to the Yodo Castle known as the residence of Lady Yodo (Hideyori TOYOTOMI's real mother).
This castle was, it is to be noted, in a different place to the Yodo Castle known as the residence of Lady Yodo (Hideyori TOYOTOMI's real mother).

sen.j: 定綱は寛永10年（1633年）3月に美濃国大垣藩に移され、代わって下総国古河藩より永井尚政が10万石で入った。
sen.e: Sadatsuna was transferred to the Ogaki Domain in the Province of Mino in 1633, and Naomasa NAGAI entered the domain from the Koga Domain in the Province of Shimousa with 100,000 koku instead.

Sadatsuna was transferred to the Ogaki Domain in Mino Province in 1633, and was replaced by Naomasa NAGAI who took over the domain from the Koga Domain in Shimousa Province with assigned revenues of 100,000 koku.

Sadatsuna was transferred to the Ogaki Domain in Mino Province in March 1633, and was replaced by Naomasa NAGAI who took over the domain from the Koga Domain in Shimousa Province with assigned revenues of 100,000 koku.

sen.j: 尚政は家臣団の編成や城下町の開発、洪水対策に備えての木津川工事などに尽力し、藩政の基盤を固めた。
sen.e: Naomasa strengthened the foundations of the domain's administration by improving the organization of its vassalage, developing the castle town, and carrying out protection work of the Kizu-gawa River for flood prevention.

Naomasa strengthened the foundations of the domain's administration by improving the organization of its vassalage, developing the castle town, and carrying out protection work of the Kizu-gawa River for flood prevention.

Naomasa strengthened the foundations of the domain's administration by improving the organization of its vassalage, developing the castle town, and carrying out protection work of the Kizu-gawa River for flood prevention.

sen.j: 尚政は明暦4年（1658年）2月28日に隠居して家督を子の永井尚征に譲る。
sen.e: Naomasa retired on 28 February 1658, and handed over the family estate to his son, Naoyuki NAGAI.
Naomasa retired on 28 February 1658, and handed over the family estate to his son, Naoyuki NAGAI.
Naomasa retired on February 28, 1658, and handed over the family estate to his son, Naoyuki NAGAI.

sen.j: このとき、尚征は所領を弟たちに分与したため、7万3600石の所領を継ぐこととなった。
sen.e: As Naoyuki distributed the territories among his brothers, he succeeded to the territory of 73,600 koku.
As Naoyuki distributed territory among his brothers, he succeeded to territory with a yield of 73,600 koku.
sen.cmt: Changed for readability. Also Added "with a yield of".
sen.e: As Naoyuki distributed territory among his brothers, he succeeded to territory with a yield of 73,600 koku.

sen.j: 例えば六男尚甲（なおのぶ）には3千石分知し、船橋陣屋を築いている。
sen.e: For example, Naonobu, the sixth son, was allotted 3,000 koku, and built the manor house of Funabashi.
For instance, Naonobu, the sixth son, was allotted territory with a yield of 3,000 koku, and built the manor house of Funabashi.
For instance, Naonobu, the sixth son, was allotted territory with a yield of 3,000 koku, and built the manor house of Funabashi.

sen.j: そして尚征は寛文9年（1669年）2月25日に丹後国宮津藩に移され、代わって伊勢亀山藩より石川憲之が6万石で入った。
sen.e: Then, Naoyuki was transferred to the Miyazu Domain in the Province of Tango on 25 February 1669, and Noriyuki ISHIKAWA entered the domain with 60,000 koku instead.
Then, Naoyuki was transferred to the Miyazu Domain in Tango Province on 25 February 1669, and Noriyuki ISHIKAWA took over the domain with assigned revenues of 60,000 koku.
sen.cmt: Changed "entered…instead" to "took over". Clarified what is meant by "with 60,000 koku."
sen.e: Then, Naoyuki was transferred to the Miyazu Domain in Tango Province on February 25, 1669, and Noriyuki ISHIKAWA took over the domain with assigned revenues of 60,000 koku.

sen.j: 憲之は宝永3年（1706年）2月25日に隠居し、その後を継いだ石川義孝は宝永7年（1710年）9月2日に死去。
sen.e: Noriyuki retired on 25 February 1706, and his successor, Yoshitaka ISHIKAWA, died on 2 September 1710.
Noriyuki retired on 25 February 1706, and his successor, Yoshitaka ISHIKAWA, died on 2 September 1710.
Noriyuki retired on February 25, 1706, and his successor, Yoshitaka ISHIKAWA, died on September 2, 1710.

sen.j: その後を継いだ石川総慶は宝永8年（1711年）2月15日に備中松山藩に移され、代わって美濃国加納藩より松平光煕が6万石で入った。
sen.e: The subsequent lord, Fusayoshi ISHIKAWA, was transferred to the Bicchu-Matsuyama Domain on 15 February 1711, and Mitsuhiro MATSUDAIRA entered the domain from the Kano Domain in the Province of Mino with 60,000 koku instead.

The next lord, Fusayoshi ISHIKAWA, was transferred to the Matsuyama Domain in Bicchu Province on 15 February 1711, and Mitsuhiro MATSUDAIRA from the Kano Domain in Mino Province took over the domain with assigned revenues of 60,000 koku.
sen.cmt: Changed "entered…instead" to "took over". Clarified the meaning of "with 60,000 koku." Also changed "the Province of ○○" to "Province ○○."
sen.e: The next lord, Fusayoshi ISHIKAWA, was transferred to the Matsuyama Domain in Bicchu Province on February 15, 1711, and Mitsuhiro MATSUDAIRA from the Kano Domain in Mino Province took over the domain with assigned revenues of 60,000 koku.
sen.cmt: 日付表記スペース削除

sen.j: 光煕は享保2年（1717年）9月4日に死去し、その後を継いだ戸田光慈は享保2年11月1日、志摩国鳥羽藩へ移され、代わって伊勢亀山藩より松平乗邑が6万石で入る。
sen.e: After Mitsuhiro died on 4 September 1717, his successor, Mitsuchika TODA, was transferred to the Toba Domain in the Province of Shima on 1 November 1717, and Norisato MATSUDAIRA entered the domain from the Kameyama Domain in the Province of Ise with 60,000 koku instead.

After Mitsuhiro died on 4 September 1717, his successor, Mitsuchika TODA, was transferred to the Toba Domain in Shima Province on 1 November 1717, and Norisato MATSUDAIRA from the Kameyama Domain in Ise Province took over the domain with assigned revenues of 60,000 koku instead.
sen.cmt: Changed "entered…instead" to "took over". Clarified the meaning of "with 60,000 koku." Also changed "the Province of ○○" to "Province ○○."
sen.e: After Mitsuhiro died on September 4, 1717, his successor, Mitsuchika TODA, was transferred to the Toba Domain in Shima Province on November 1, 1717, and Norisato MATSUDAIRA from the Kameyama Domain in Ise Province took over the domain with assigned revenues of 60,000 koku instead.

sen.j: しかし享保8年（1723年）5月1日には下総国佐倉藩へ移され、入れ替わりで稲葉正知が10万2000石で入ることで、ようやく藩主家が定着した。
sen.e: However, on 1 May 1723, he was transferred to the Sakura Domain in the Province of Shimousa, and after Masatomo INABA entered the domain instead of him with 102,000 koku, this lord family lasted long.

However, on 1 May 1723, he was transferred to the Sakura Domain in Shimousa Province, and was replaced with Masatomo INABA who took over with 102,000 koku and began a long-term presence for the INABA family.

However, on May 1, 1723, he was transferred to the Sakura Domain in Shimousa Province, and was replaced with Masatomo INABA who took over with 102,000 koku and began a long-term presence for the INABA family.

sen.j: 以後、稲葉氏の支配によって明治時代を迎えることとなる。
sen.e: Then, the Yodo Domain entered the Meiji period under the rule of the Inaba family.
The Yodo Domain entered the Meiji period under the rule of the Inaba family.
The Yodo Domain entered the Meiji period under the rule of the Inaba clan.

sen.j: 稲葉氏は明治17年（1884年）、華族令により子爵に列せられた。
sen.e: In 1884, the Inaba family was ranked as Viscount by the Peerage Law.
In 1884, the Inaba family given the rank of Viscount under the Peerage Law.
In 1884, the Inaba clan given the rank of Viscount under the Peerage Law.

sen.j: 淀藩の基盤は、永井氏によって確立された。
sen.e: The Nagai family established the administrative foundation of the Yodo Domain.
The Nagai family established the administrative foundations of the Yodo Domain.
The Nagai clan established the administrative foundations of the Yodo Domain.

sen.j: 尚政は城下町の拡大や水上交通の整備、地子免除などを行なっている。
sen.e: Naomasa carried out the expansion of the castle town, the improvement of the water traffic, and the land tax exemption.
Naomasa expanded the castle town, the improvement the water transport, and brought in a land tax exemption.
Naomasa expanded the castle town, improved the water transport, and brought in a land tax exemption.

sen.j: 石川憲之は検地政策や元禄国絵図作成などで功を挙げ、幕政にも参与している。
sen.e: Noriyuki ISHIKAWA, who achieved good results in practicing the land survey policy and making Genroku Kuni Ezu (a national land map), participated in the shogunate administration.
Noriyuki ISHIKAWA, who achieved good results with a land survey policy and in the making of Genroku Kuni Ezu (a national land map), also participated in the shogunate administration.
Noriyuki ISHIKAWA, who achieved good results with a land survey policy and in the making of Genroku Kuni Ezu (a national land map), also participated in the shogunate administration.

sen.j: 松平乗邑の場合は大坂城代代行の立場から、徳川吉宗に見出されて老中にまで異例の栄進を遂げて入ってきた大名である。
sen.e: Norisato MATSUDAIRA was a daimyo who earned exceptionally rapid promotion from the acting keeper of the Osaka Castle to the Senior Councillor of the Tokugawa shogunate because Yoshimune TOKUGAWA patronized him.

Norisato MATSUDAIRA was a daimyo who earned exceptionally rapid promotion from acting keeper of the Osaka Castle to become Senior Councillor of the Tokugawa shogunate due to the patronage of Yoshimune TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: "due to the patronage" is better than "patronized"
sen.e: Norisato MATSUDAIRA was a daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) who earned exceptionally rapid promotion from acting keeper of the Osaka Castle to become Senior Councillor of the Tokugawa shogunate due to the patronage of Yoshimune TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 稲葉氏は、10万2000石という大領ではあったが、その所領は山城のほかに摂津国・河内国・近江国・下総・越後などに分散しているという不安定さで、山城にあった所領は2万石にも満たなかったと言われている。
sen.e: The Inaba family had large territories of 102,000 koku, which were insecure enough to be spread over not only the Province of Yamashiro but also the Province of Settsu, the Kawachi, the Omi, the Shimousa, and the Echigo; the one in the Province of Yamashiro was said to be less than 20,000 koku.

The Inaba family had large territories with a yield of 102,000 koku, but they were spread not only throughout Yamashiro Province but also the Settsu Province, the Kawachi, the Omi, the Shimousa, and the Echigo, with the one Yamashiro Province said to be worth less than 20,000 koku.
sen.cmt: Changed for readability. Also changed "province of ○○ to ○○ province" as per word list of August 5th.
sen.e: The Inaba clan had large territories with a yield of 102,000 koku, but they were spread not only throughout Yamashiro Province but also the Settsu Province, the Kawachi, the Omi, the Shimousa, and the Echigo, with the one Yamashiro Province said to be worth less than 20,000 koku.

sen.j: このため、藩政においても財政基盤の脆弱さから人夫の徴発さえままならず、財政は苦しかった。
sen.e: Accordingly, the financial basis of its administration was so fragile that it was hard to secure sufficient labor; thus, the domain was in financial difficulty.
Due to this spread of territory, the financial basis of its administration was fragile, it was hard to secure sufficient labor, and the domain was in financial difficulty.
Due to this spread of territory, the financial basis of its administration was fragile, it was hard to secure sufficient labor, and the domain was in financial difficulty.

sen.j: 第7代藩主・稲葉正のぶは天明4年（1784年）に越後の所領を和泉国や近江国に移したが、これにより所領10万2000石は8カ国に分散することとなり、全くの逆効果を招いた。
sen.e: Masanobu INABA, the seventh lord of the domain, moved the territory of the Province of Echigo to the Province of Izumi and the Omi in 1784, and as the result, the territories of 102,000 koku were spread over eight Provinces, which brought about a contrary effect on its finanial situation.

Masanobu INABA, the seventh lord of the domain, moved the territory of Echigo Province to Izumi Provnice and the Omi in 1784, and as the result, the territories of 102,000 koku were spread over eight Provinces, which brought about a contrary effect on its finanial situation.
sen.cmt: Changed "province of ○○ to ○○ province" as per word list of August 5th.
sen.e: Masanobu INABA, the seventh lord of the domain, moved the territory of Echigo Province to Izumi Provnice and the Omi in 1784, and as the result, the territories of 102,000 koku were spread over eight Provinces, which brought about a contrary effect on its financial situation.

sen.j: また、稲葉氏の歴代藩主は短命な者が多く、享保年間には4人の藩主が相次いで死去している。
sen.e: Many successive lords of the Inaba family were short-lived, and four of them died one after another during the Kyoho era.
Many successive lords of the Inaba family were short-lived, and four of them died in quick succession during the Kyoho era.
sen.cmt: Changed "one after another" to "in quick succession". Also changed "family" to "clan".
sen.e: Many successive lords of the Inaba clan were short-lived, and four of them died in quick succession during the Kyoho era.

sen.j: ちなみに、稲葉氏の歴代藩主の中でもっとも有名な藩主は第12代（最後）の藩主・稲葉正邦である。
sen.e: The most prominent figure among the lords of the Inaba family was Masakuni INABA, the 12th lord (the last).
The most prominent figure among the lords of the Inaba clan was Masakuni INABA, the 12th (and last) lord.
The most prominent figure among the lords of the Inaba clan was Masakuni INABA, the twelfth (and last) lord.

sen.j: 正邦は幕末期の動乱の中で老中を二度務め、板倉勝静や小笠原長行らと共に活躍した人物である。
sen.e: Serving as Rojyu (Senior Councillor of the Tokugawa shogunate) twice amid the upheavals of the end of the Edo period, Masakuni did remarkable services with Katsukiyo ITAKURA and Nagamichi OGASAWARA.

Becoming Rojyu (Senior Councillor of the Tokugawa shogunate) twice amid the upheavals of the end of the Edo period, Masakuni served in an effective manner with Katsukiyo ITAKURA and Nagamichi OGASAWARA.

Becoming Roju (Senior Councillor of the Tokugawa shogunate) twice amid the upheavals of the end of the Edo period, Masakuni served in an effective manner with Katsukiyo ITAKURA and Nagamichi OGASAWARA.

sen.j: しかし、長行や勝静らが函館まで転戦し、最後まで幕府に忠義を尽くしたのとは違い、この正邦は慶応4年（1868年）の戊辰戦争において藤堂高猷の裏切りにより敗走する幕府軍兵が淀城に入城しようと保護を求めてきたとき、淀藩ではそれを一方的に拒否して城門を開こうとすらしなかった（藩主・正邦はこの時江戸城にいた）。
sen.e: Although Nagamichi and Katsukiyo fought through the Battle of Hakodate, and were faithful to the Tokugawa shogunate to the end, the Yodo Domain under the rule of Masakuni refused bluntly to open the gate of the castle when the shogunate troops which had been betrayed by Takayuki TODO and routed in the Boshin War of 1868 asked to enter the Yodo Castle for shelter. (When it happened, the lord, Masakuni, stayed in the Edo Castle.)

However, when Nagamichi and Katsukiyo fought in the Battle of Hakodate, faithful to the Tokugawa shogunate to the end, the Yodo Domain under the rule of Masakuni refused bluntly to open the gate of Yodo castle when the shogunate troops who had been betrayed by Takayuki TODO and routed in the Boshin War of 1868 asked for shelter (Masakuni was in Edo Castle at the time).

However, when Nagamichi and Katsukiyo fought in the Battle of Hakodate, faithful to the Tokugawa shogunate to the end, the Yodo Domain under the rule of Masakuni refused point blank to open the gate of Yodo castle when the shogunate troops who had been betrayed by Takayuki TODO and routed in the Boshin War of 1868 asked for shelter (Masakuni was in Edo Castle at the time).

sen.j: このため、戊辰戦争における幕府軍の京都戦線での敗北は決定的となったと言われている。
sen.e: This made it certain that the shogunate troops were completely defeated at the battles in Kyoto during the Boshin War.
This made it certain that the shogunate troops would be completely defeated at the battles in Kyoto during the Boshin War.
This made it certain that the shogunate troops would be completely defeated at the battles in Kyoto during the Boshin War.

sen.j: 後に正邦は高猷と並んで「裏切り者の犬」として幕府側からも新政府側からも侮蔑された。
sen.e: Later, Masakuni and Takayuki were despised as "the dogs of betrayal" from both sides: the Tokugawa shogunate and the new government.
Later, Masakuni and Takayuki were despised as "treacherous dogs" by both the Tokugawa shogunate and the new government.
Later, Masakuni and Takayuki were despised as 'treacherous dogs' by both the Tokugawa shogunate and the new government.

sen.j: 正邦は新政府の命令で同年3月に謹慎処分となったが、閏4月には許されて京都警備を任されている。
sen.e: Masakuni was ordered house arrest by the new government in March, 1868, but after being forgiven, he was assigned to guard Kyoto in April.
Masakuni was put under house arrest by the new government in March, 1868, but was forgiven and assigned to guard Kyoto in April.
Masakuni was put under house arrest by the new government in March, 1868, but was forgiven and assigned to guard Kyoto in April.

sen.j: 翌年の版籍奉還により藩知事となり、明治4年（1871年）の廃藩置県で免官。
sen.e: Next year, he became the governor of the domain after Hansekihokan (the return of the domain registers to the Meiji Emperor), and lost his position following Haihan Chiken (the abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) in 1871.

The following year, he became the governor of the domain after Hansekihokan (the return of the domain registers to the Meiji Emperor), and then, in 1871, lost his position in the Haihan Chiken (the abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures).

The following year, he became the governor of the domain after Hansekihokan (the return of the domain registers to the Meiji Emperor), and then, in 1871, lost his position in the Haihan Chiken (the abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures).

sen.j: 淀藩は廃藩となり、その所領は格近辺の府県に組み込まれることとなったのである。
sen.e: The Yodo Domain was abolished, and its territories were incorporated into prefectures in their vicinity.
The Yodo Domain was abolished, and its territories were incorporated into the corresponding prefectures.
The Yodo Domain was abolished, and its territories were incorporated into the corresponding prefectures.

tit.e: The successive lords of the domain
List of the lords of the domain in chronological order
The chronological order of the Lords.

tit.j: 松平（久松）（まつだいら（ひさまつ））家

sen.j: 親藩。
sen.e: The Shinpan (a type of family status of the daimyo)
The Shinpan (a type of family status for daimyo)
The Shinpan (a type of family status for daimyo)
35,000 koku
35,000 koku
35,000 koku

sen.j: 松平定綱（さだつな）＜従五位下。越中守＞【元和9年閏8月20日藩主就任－寛永10年3月23日移封】
sen.e: Sadatsuna MATSUDAIRA <Jugoige (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Governor of the Province of Ecchu "appointed as the lord of the domain on 20 August 1623 - transferred on 23 March 1633"
Sadatsuna MATSUDAIRA <Jugoige (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Governor of the Province of Ecchu "appointed as the lord of the domain on 20 August 1623 - transferred on 23 March 1633"
Sadatsuna MATSUDAIRA <Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Governor of Ecchu Province> "appointed as the lord of the domain on August 20, 1623 - transferred on March 23, 1633"
sen.cmt: ”<”の括弧閉じが脱落している。“<Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Governor of the Ecchu Province ” -> “<Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Governor of Ecchu Province >”

sen.j: 譜代。
sen.e: The fudai daimyo (hereditary daimyo)
The fudai daimyo (hereditary daimyo)
The fudai daimyo (hereditary daimyo)

sen.j: 永井尚政（なおまさ）＜従四位下。信濃守＞【寛永10年3月25日藩主就任－明暦4年2月28日隠居】〔老中〕
sen.e: Naomasa NAGAI <Jushiige (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Governor of the Province of Shinano> "appointed as the lord of the domain on 23 March 1633 - retired on 28 February 1658"[Rojyu (Senior Councillor of the Tokugawa shogunate)]

Naomasa NAGAI <Jushiige (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Governor of the Province of Shinano> "appointed as the lord of the domain on 23 March 1633 - retired on 28 February 1658"[Rojyu (Senior Councillor of the Tokugawa shogunate)]

Naomasa NAGAI <Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Governor of Shinano Province> "appointed as the lord of the domain on March 25, 1633 - retired on February 28, 1658"[Roju (Senior Councillor of the Tokugawa shogunate)]

sen.j: 永井尚征（なおゆき）＜従五位下。右近大夫＞【明暦4年2月28日藩主就任－寛文9年2月25日移封】
sen.e: Naoyuki NAGAI <Jugoige (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Government Official of the Imperial Guards> "appointed as the lord of the domain on 28 February 1658 - transferred on 25 February 1669"
Naoyuki NAGAI <Jugoige (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Government Official of the Imperial Guards> "appointed as the lord of the domain on 28 February 1658 - transferred on 25 February 1669"
Naoyuki NAGAI <Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Government Official of the Imperial Guards> "appointed as the lord of the domain on February 28, 1658 - transferred on February 25, 1669"

sen.j: 石川（いしかわ）家
sen.e: The house of Ishikawa
The house of Ishikawa
The Ishikawa family

sen.j: 譜代。
sen.e: The fudai daimyo
The fudai daimyo

sen.j: 6万石。
sen.e: 60,000 koku
